Key Match Events: The Cubs extended their win streak to five games, matching their season high for a third time
The Cubs scored four runs in the fifth inning to take the lead
Hoerner delivered the much-needed insurance run in the seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: Nico Hoerner: 'It means a lot. When you're trailing, every game is that much more important'
Cubs manager David Ross: 'I'm proud of the guys for putting together a great stretch of baseball and giving ourselves a chance here'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs finished August with a record of 18-8
The Cubs know it will take work, but with key additions to expand the roster in September that could add another enhance the team, it’s possible to achieve the goal
Others: The Nationals starter DJ Herz, the Cubs' eighth-round pick in the 2019 Draft before being traded to Washington, held the offense to no hits going into the fifth inning
The Cubs' offense delivered yet again in a four-run fifth inning that gave them the runs they needed to hold off Washington

The Cubs took advantage to add one final run in the inning. Dansby Swanson doubled down the left-field line -- knocking his sixth extra-base hit and 11th RBI in the past nine games -- to give the Cubs a fourth run in the inning

The Nats began to creep up again by scoring a third run off a wild pitch at the bottom of the fifth, but Hoerner delivered the much-needed insurance run, scoring on a throwing error in the seventh inning to secure the victory

Crow-Armstrong chased down the single in the sixth inning by Nationals third base rookie José Tena deep into center field. He quickly turned and threw to Hoerner at second in time to nab Tena to keep him off the basepaths
Bethancourt also came up with another big throw to Swanson in the sixth to catch CJ Abrams stealing second base
